text: hi guys today on sweet talk I have a
recipe that's guaranteed to satisfy any
chocolate craving chocolate bun cake
with ganache glaze you'll love how
simple this is and the glaze makes it
feel dressy enough for a special
occasion I'm starting with my dry
ingredients here I have two and a
quarter cups of all-purpose flour to
that I'm adding 3/4 of a cup of
unsweetened cocoa powder give this a
quick whisk then I'm adding one teaspoon
of baking soda and one teaspoon of
kosher salt get this totally combined
make sure the baking soda is all whisked
in now I'm going to combine 1/2 a cup of
whole milk with half a cup of sour cream
I'm just going to do this right into the
measuring cup and the sour cream adds
some nice extra moisture to the cake
it's a good secret weapon when you're
making a chocolate cake right combined
now we can move over to our butter and
sugar here I have two sticks of
room-temperature butter to that I'm
adding a cup and a half of granulated
sugar get the butter and sugar going on
medium high until it's nice and fluffy
it takes about three minutes
perfect give this a quick scrape down
the bowl now I'll add four
room-temperature eggs when I'm cracking
more than one egg I usually like to do
it into a separate bowl so that you make
sure you're not getting any eggshell
pieces into your batter
it's never fun when you crack your last
egg and get a bunch of eggshell in there
so now I'll bring this up to medium and
add my eggs one at a time you want to
wait until each one's incorporated that
helps it make a really smooth batter
now I'm adding one teaspoon of vanilla
extract now that that's combined I'm
going to be adding my dry ingredients
with the milk mixture alternating the
dry with the milk so put that on low
I'll add about half of this cocoa and
flour mixture
[Applause]
I'll add the milk on the sour cream
adding the dry and the wet ingredients
and stages like this kind of helps the
batter remains stable nice and smooth
you don't want a broken batter and the
remaining dry ingredients I love the
smell of cocoa powder and this is
already making my taste buds water
alright
so now I'll give the last few mixes with
my spatula by hand to make sure that it
doesn't over mix let's create some of
this batter off although some would say
this is the best part right here make
sure you get all the dry ingredients off
of the bottom of the bowl looks like
there's some butter and sugar down there
so I want to make sure it gets
completely combined into our batter so
now I have a prepared bundt pan here I
have buttered this with room-temperature
butter and then sprinkled it with cocoa
powder this helps prevent sticking
because bundt pans can sometimes be
notorious for a little bit of sticking
in all of the grooves I'm just gonna add
this in evenly around the bundt pan I
have my oven preheating to 325 degrees
and I know a bundt pan might seem like
special equipment but it's such an easy
way to elevate a really simple dessert
this is just cake batter but it looks so
pretty when it's baked in a bundt ring
and glazed with the ganache so such a
luscious chocolaty batter
all the batter so now I'm just going to
smooth out the top to make sure it's
even in here looks so fudgy and
delicious now I'm just gonna bake this
in my 325 degree oven for 55 minutes
until a tester comes out clean while my
cake bakes I'm making the ganache glaze
so here I have half a cup of heavy cream
and I'm gonna bring this up to just a
boil until bubbles are kind of breaking
around the edges trying to make sure
that it doesn't burn on the bottom so
you can stir it every once in a while
all right just about there it's
definitely starting to bubble around the
edges but make sure it's hot enough to
melt my chocolate all right perfect now
I'm pouring this over three ounces of
bittersweet chocolate I'm going to let
this sit for two minutes let the
chocolate get nice and melty before I
mix this together alright so since I'm
sitting for a couple minutes I'm adding
two tablespoons of unsalted butter this
will add a nice richness and shininess
to our glaze now just slowly start
stirring it all together it might look a
little broken and crazy at first but as
you stir it it'll come together to a
nice smooth glaze alright my chocolates
melted in now I just need to make sure
the butter is totally incorporated you
don't want a big chunk of butter in your
glaze alright our glaze is beautiful and
smooth and I'm gonna let this set for a
couple more minutes just let it thicken
up and then we're ready to glaze our
bundt cake so my cake is out of the oven
I've let it cool completely popped it
out of the back pan it looks amazing and
now for the fun part the ganache glaze
so I have my glaze here it's thickened
up just a little bit so it's still
pourable and I'm just going to start
pouring it around the top and letting it
drip down the sides
if you're enjoying this video be sure to
